By car, via the N7 national road.  The nearest airport is Cape Town International.
Moorreesburg is known as the breadbasket of the Western Cape and lies in the heart of the Swartland about 100 km from Cape Town, on the N7 to Namibia.
Wheat Industry Museum One of three of its kind in the world.

Guestfarms in the area are very popular especially for Capetonians to breakaway for a weekend. There are activities on the Bergriver eg, camping, canoeing, swimming, fishing and hiking. For the more adventurous we have 4x4 routes, clay pigeon shooting and wingshooting. These guestfarms have ideal teambuilding facilities.

Oscars' Lounge Bar at the Samoa Hotel oozes ambience with its fireplace for cold Winter evenings and a selection of Pub-style meals.  Meet the locals for a game of darts or relax and catch up with the news and sporting events on DSTV.

value: name=The Samoa Hotel and Conference Centre

content=A landmark in Moorreesburg, initially having been bought in the early 1900s and remaining in the Katz family till 2005.  The hotel offers comfortable corporate accommodation in 15 double ensuite rooms and is TGCSA accredited
